abstract.para: Virtualization design provides many capabilities to your organization.

sect1.title: Server Consolidation
sect1.para: Many servers can be replaced by one big physical server, so hardware is consolidated, and Guest Operating Systems are converted to virtual machine. It provides the ability to run legacy software on new hardware.

sect1.title: Isolation
sect1.para: Guest operating system can be fully isolated from the Host running it. So if the virtual machine is corrupted, the Host system is not harmed. It's also doesn't affect any other virtual machines. No data is shared between VM.

sect1.title: Migration
sect1.para: A process to move a running virtual machine to another physical machine. Live migration is an extended feature that allows this move without disconnection of the client or the application.

sect1.title: Disaster recovery
sect1.para: guests are less dependent on the hardware, and the Host server provides snapshot features to be able to restore a known running system without any corruption.

sect1.title: Dynamic load balancing
sect1.para: A migration feature that brings a simple way to load-balance your service across your infrastructure.
